resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

fields.description:
If Eucalyptus DNS is enabled, S3 tools run into issues where they work some of time.  If the S3 tool is configured to point at the ENABLED Walrus, everything works as expected.

*Using Walrus DNS with s3cmd - walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com - 2013-03-11 15:39:05 - success*

{code}
euca-prod-1-82:s3cmd haroldspencerjr$ ./s3cmd --config=../.s3cfg-hasp ls

{code}
euca-prod-1-82:s3cmd haroldspencerjr$ ./s3cmd --config=../.s3cfg-hasp ls
WARNING: Retrying failed request: /services/Walrus/ ([Errno 8] nodename nor servname provided, or not known)
WARNING: Waiting 3 sec...
WARNING: Retrying failed request: /services/Walrus/ ([Errno 8] nodename nor servname provided, or not known)
WARNING: Waiting 6 sec...
WARNING: Retrying failed request: /services/Walrus/ ([Errno 8] nodename nor servname provided, or not known)
WARNING: Waiting 9 sec...

WARNING: Waiting 12 sec...

WARNING: Waiting 15 sec...

!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
    An unexpected error has occurred.
  Please report the following lines to:
   s3tools-bugs@lists.sourceforge.net
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Problem: S3RequestError: Request failed for: /services/Walrus/
S3cmd:   1.5.0-alpha3

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./s3cmd", line 2098, in <module>

  File "./s3cmd", line 2038, in main

  File "./s3cmd", line 106, in cmd_ls

    response = s3.list_all_buckets()
  File "/Users/haroldspencerjr/s3cmd/S3/S3.py", line 219, in list_all_buckets
    response = self.send_request(request)
  File "/Users/haroldspencerjr/s3cmd/S3/S3.py", line 682, in send_request
    return self.send_request(request, body, retries - 1)
  File "/Users/haroldspencerjr/s3cmd/S3/S3.py", line 682, in send_request
    return self.send_request(request, body, retries - 1)
  File "/Users/haroldspencerjr/s3cmd/S3/S3.py", line 682, in send_request
    return self.send_request(request, body, retries - 1)
  File "/Users/haroldspencerjr/s3cmd/S3/S3.py", line 682, in send_request
    return self.send_request(request, body, retries - 1)
  File "/Users/haroldspencerjr/s3cmd/S3/S3.py", line 682, in send_request

  File "/Users/haroldspencerjr/s3cmd/S3/S3.py", line 684, in send_request

S3RequestError: Request failed for: /services/Walrus/

!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
    An unexpected error has occurred.
    Please report the above lines to:
   s3tools-bugs@lists.sourceforge.net
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
{code}

*Using s3cmd with ENABLED Walrus (192.168.39.102) - 2013-03-11 16:16:36 - success*

{code}
euca-prod-1-82:s3cmd haroldspencerjr$ ./s3cmd --config=../.s3cfg-hasp --version
s3cmd version 1.5.0-alpha3
euca-prod-1-82:s3cmd haroldspencerjr$ ./s3cmd --config=../.s3cfg-hasp ls s3://neo4j-ha
                       DIR   s3://neo4j-ha/
2013-02-04 15:15      7710   s3://neo4j-ha/neo4j-ha.sh
2013-02-03 17:18      7712   s3://neo4j-ha/neo4j-test.sh
euca-prod-1-82:s3cmd haroldspencerjr$ ./s3cmd --config=../.s3cfg-hasp mb s3://s3cmd-alpha3-test
Bucket 's3://s3cmd-alpha3-test/' created
euca-prod-1-82:s3cmd haroldspencerjr$ ./s3cmd --config=../.s3cfg-hasp put ../syslog s3://s3cmd-alpha3-test/syslog
../syslog -> s3://s3cmd-alpha3-test/syslog  [1 of 1]
 58348 of 58348   100% in    2s    24.29 kB/s  done
euca-prod-1-82:s3cmd haroldspencerjr$ ./s3cmd --config=../.s3cfg-hasp del s3://s3cmd-alpha3-test/syslog
File s3://s3cmd-alpha3-test/syslog deleted
euca-prod-1-82:s3cmd haroldspencerjr$ ./s3cmd --config=../.s3cfg-hasp put --acl-public ../syslog s3://s3cmd-alpha3-test/syslog
../syslog -> s3://s3cmd-alpha3-test/syslog  [1 of 1]
 58348 of 58348   100% in    1s    32.41 kB/s  done
Public URL of the object is: http://s3cmd-alpha3-test.192.168.39.102:8773/syslog
euca-prod-1-82:s3cmd haroldspencerjr$ wget http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Walrus/s3cmd-alpha3-test/syslog
--2013-03-11 16:20:34--  http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Walrus/s3cmd-alpha3-test/syslog
Connecting to 192.168.39.102:8773... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: 58348 (57K) [binary/octet-stream]
Saving to: ‘syslog’

100%[===================================================================================================================>] 58,348       155KB/s   in 0.4s

Last-modified header invalid -- time-stamp ignored.
2013-03-11 16:20:35 (155 KB/s) - ‘syslog’ saved [58348/58348]

euca-prod-1-82:s3cmd haroldspencerjr$ ./s3cmd --config=../.s3cfg-hasp del s3://s3cmd-alpha3-test/syslog
File s3://s3cmd-alpha3-test/syslog deleted
euca-prod-1-82:s3cmd haroldspencerjr$ ./s3cmd --config=../.s3cfg-hasp rb s3://s3cmd-alpha3-test/syslog
ERROR: Parameter problem: Expecting S3 URI with just the bucket name set instead of 's3://s3cmd-alpha3-test/syslog'
euca-prod-1-82:s3cmd haroldspencerjr$ ./s3cmd --config=../.s3cfg-hasp rb s3://s3cmd-alpha3-test
Bucket 's3://s3cmd-alpha3-test/' removed
{code}

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-services
SERVICE	cluster        	enter-the-wu   	gza            	DISABLED  	20  	http://192.168.39.104:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:enter-the-wu:cluster:gza/

SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	192.168.39.101 	ENABLED   	20  	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::192.168.39.101/
SERVICE	storage        	enter-the-wu   	method-man     	ENABLED   	20  	http://192.168.39.103:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:enter-the-wu:storage:method-man/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.101 	ENABLED   	20  	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.39.101/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.102 	DISABLED  	20  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.168.39.102/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	iron-flag      	ENABLED   	20  	http://192.168.39.102:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:iron-flag/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	wu-tang-forever	DISABLED  	20  	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:wu-tang-forever/
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	192.168.39.101 	ENABLED   	20  	http://192.168.39.101:8773/services/Dns 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:192.168.39.101/
{code}
fields.summary: Eucalyptus DNS causes issues with S3 Tools (e.g s3cmd)

comments.body:
Here is my s3cfg config file:

{code}
[default]
access_key = <ACCESS-KEY>
acl_public = False
bucket_location = US
debug_syncmatch = False
default_mime_type = binary/octet-stream
delete_removed = False
dry_run = False
encrypt = False
force = False
gpg_command = /usr/bin/gpg
gpg_decrypt = %(gpg_command)s -d --verbose --no-use-agent --batch --yes --passphrase-fd %(passphrase_fd)s -o %(output_file)s %(input_file)s
gpg_encrypt = %(gpg_command)s -c --verbose --no-use-agent --batch --yes --passphrase-fd %(passphrase_fd)s -o %(output_file)s %(input_file)s
gpg_passphrase =
guess_mime_type = False
service_path = /services/Walrus
host_base = walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773
host_bucket = walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773
human_readable_sizes = False
preserve_attrs = True
proxy_host =
proxy_port = 0
recv_chunk = 4096
secret_key = <SECRET-KEY>
send_chunk = 4096
use_https = False
verbosity = WARNING
{code}

Harold Spencer: will get this set up and reproduced on lab machines and then point me to it, I think this will be the fastest way do do this.  Please test this using the experimental.dns to see if this is still an issue.
Harold any movement on getting this reproduced?

Hey [~mmunn1],

Plan to do a set up this week.  I will keep you posted.

Hey [~mmunn1],

I have a non-HA setup going right now.  I just need to add the additional machines.  I will be working on that in the next couple of days.  Sorry for the delay on this.  I will ping you when i am done.
[~hspencer], you should check against 4.0 when you get a chance and update this ticket

This issue was previously scheduled to be worked on in more than one sprint:
* '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Test 3.3 Board')
* '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Copy of 3.3 Release Board')

Starting from JIRA Agile 6.3, an issue can only belong to a single future sprint. Read more about this change: http://docs.atlassian.com/agile/docs-0640/Sprint+Marker+Migration

This issue is now scheduled for future sprint '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Copy of 3.3 Release Board').

If this is incorrect, please update the issue accordingly.

This comment was automatically generated by JIRA. If it is no longer relevant, please feel free to delete it.

[~hspencer] I think we can actually create a test harness by just using the socket module in python and remove the need to use S3 to test this condition.

It's probably already apparent that the hostname lookup is failing. Looking at the s3cmd code, it relies on using httplib.HTTPConnection and the error doesn't trigger until the request is actually made:
{code}
>>> c2 = httplib.HTTPConnection('wwwwwwwwwww')
>>> c2.request('GET','/index.html')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/httplib.py", line 973, in request
    self._send_request(method, url, body, headers)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/httplib.py", line 1007, in _send_request
    self.endheaders(body)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/httplib.py", line 969, in endheaders
    self._send_output(message_body)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/httplib.py", line 829, in _send_output
    self.send(msg)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/httplib.py", line 791, in send
    self.connect()
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/httplib.py", line 772, in connect
    self.timeout, self.source_address)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/socket.py", line 553, in create_connection
    for res in getaddrinfo(host, port, 0, SOCK_STREAM):
socket.gaierror: [Errno 8] nodename nor servname provided, or not known
{code}

From that we can see that it is making a call to socket.getaddrinfo(), so I think we should be able to call that (or socket.gethostbyname) directly and bypass having to use S3, since this is a DNS problem:

{code}
>>> socket.gethostbyname('www.google.com')
'74.125.224.180'
>>> socket.gethostbyname_ex('www.google.com')
('www.google.com', [], ['74.125.224.180', '74.125.224.176', '74.125.224.177', '74.125.224.178', '74.125.224.179'])
{code}

For purity, we should take the same code path, so just make the getaddrinfo() call:
{code}
>>> socket.getaddrinfo('www.google.com',80,0,socket.SOCK_STREAM)
[(2, 1, 6, '', ('74.125.224.178', 80)), (2, 1, 6, '', ('74.125.224.179', 80)), (2, 1, 6, '', ('74.125.224.180', 80)), (2, 1, 6, '', ('74.125.224.176', 80)), (2, 1, 6, '', ('74.125.224.177', 80)), (30, 1, 6, '', ('2001:4860:4007:800::1012', 80, 0, 0))]
>>> socket.getaddrinfo('wwwwwwww',80,0,socket.SOCK_STREAM)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
socket.gaierror: [Errno 8] nodename nor servname provided, or not known
>>>
{code}

Note that the port (80) isn't important here, that is just used to construct the return tuple that could be used to create a socket to the host. 

Something like the following should work (inside a while True loop) :
{code}
>>> socket.getaddrinfo('walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com',8773,0,socket.SOCK_STREAM)
{code}

[~sgraham],

Thanks for the analysis.  I really appreciate it.  [~mmunn1], I tried to reproduce this issue on 4.0.1 with Eucalyptus DNS enabled, and I couldn't reproduce (however in my testing I found this error - EUCA-9957).  I hope this helps. 

I definitely agree this can be added to a test case in [eutester|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eutester].  Is there a certain place under [testcases|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eutester/tree/testing/testcases] that Eucalyptus DNS tests will be located?  If so, I can track and keep using them to test current/future clouds. 

Let me know if you guys me to help out here.  Again, thanks for getting this knocked out.
[~hspencer] So can we close this one a not reproducible and leave  EUCA-9957 open?
[~sgraham] If you want to create a eutester testcase for this please feel free to do so. I am going to close this as not reproducible
